Karen Baker Landers

The sound editor has been nominated to two

awards through her whole career and winning both

of them. They were The Bourne Ultimatum (2008) and

Skyfall (2013). Both awards were shared with

also sound editor Per Hallberg.

Nina Hartstone

She won Best Sound Editing in 2019 for Bohemian

Rhapsody, along with John Warhurst. She has since

not received any other nomination in this category.

Michelle Couttolenc

The sound engineer won the award for Best Sound

in 2021 for the movie The Sound of Metal, along with

Nicolas Becker, Jaime Baksht, Carlos Cort√©s and Phillip Bladh

Lora Hirschberg

The sound engineer won an award in the

category of Best Sound Mixing in 2011 for

Inception. She was also nominated in the same category

in 2008 for The Dark Knight.

Sara Bennett

She won an award in the category Visual Effects

in 2015 for the movie Ex Machina, together with

Andrew Whitehurst, Paul Norris and Mark Ardington.

Bennett is the only woman who has won this award

since 2000.

98.3% of nominees for the category

Visual Effects are men, while 1.7% are women.

Thelma Schoonmaker

She has won three awards in the category

Film Editing, all with movies directed by Martin Scorsese.

She received two of these awards in the last twenty

years for The Aviator (2004) and The Departed (2006).

She got her first award in 1980 for Raging Bull.

Margaret Sixel

She has only been nominated in one ocassion, in which

she won for the movie Mad Max: Fury Road (2016).

She has participated as editor in many other of movies,

including some of George Miller’s, Sixel’s husband.

82.9% of nominees for the category

Film Editing are men, while 17.1% are women.
